flashcards.english: Gītahuha (puff adder), Mūrarū (green grass snake), Gīīko (cobra)
flashcards.notes: Specific snake species. Nyoka is general term for snake. Context: Andīka marītwa ma nyamū ciathī (Write names of snakes)

flashcards.english: Njooma (common cold), Kīhuti (cold sores around mouth)
flashcards.notes: Basic health/disease vocabulary. Context: Andīka marītwa ma mīrimū (Write names of diseases in Kikuyu)

flashcards.english: Kĩũngũyũ / thamaki (fish - singular), Ciũngũyũ / thamaki (several fish - plural)
flashcards.notes: Fish vocabulary with two terms. Question: Agĩkũyũ nĩ mwatigira gũtherũkia ciũngũyũ? (Kikuyus have stopped boiling fish?). Gũtherũkia = to boil

flashcards.english: Thigiriri (tiny common black ants), Thūraita (large black ants), Mūgagaca (tiny brown ants), Thuraku (soldier ants), Mūthūa (termites), Igi (wasp)
flashcards.notes: Complete ant and insect classification. Shows detailed knowledge of ant species by size and color. Cultural importance: ants feature in traditional stories

flashcards.english: Mũndũ ũmwe (1 person), Andũ erĩ (2 people), atatũ (3), ana (4), atano (5), atandatũ (6), mũgwanja (7), anana (8), kenda (9), ikũmi (10), ikũmi na ũmwe (11)
flashcards.notes: Numbers 1-11 showing agreement with Class 1 nouns (people). Pattern changes: ĩmwe→ũmwe, igĩrĩ→erĩ, ĩthatũ→atatũ, etc. Demonstrates noun class concord system

flashcards.english: Ũtheri (light), Nduma (darkness). Light sources: Ũtheri wa rĩũa (sunlight), wa mweri na njata (moonlight & stars), wa thitima (electric light), wa mũcũmaa (candle), wa toci (torch), wa mwaki wa ngũ (firewood fire)
flashcards.notes: Complete light sources vocabulary showing traditional (mwaki wa ngũ, mũcũmaa) and modern (thitima, toci) sources. Ũtheri wa = light of/from
